page.title: 20Community
page.content: The church in the village was originally built in the 13th century but was partly destroyed during Henry VIII reign when he desolved the monasteries.Since this time it has been rebuilt to its present state.2 of the 3 bells are original.It belongs to the Church of England faith and was dedicated to the patron saint of St. Thomas.The Latvian community at Catthorpe Manor use the church once a week. Catthorpe Manor is a home for Latvian refugees from world war 2 and is used once a year by the 2000 Latvian residents in the U.K.,when they all meet to celebrate St. John's day (June 24th.) Dunsmore House-a private residential home for the elderly. A fete is held once a year,organised by the all members of the village.
